intro: Eumachia straminea, commonly known as the yellow ant plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it often grows in moist, shaded environments. It is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant. Eumachia straminea also has traditional medicinal uses in some African cultures.
